title: We get our first good look at Grand Admiral Thrawn in Ahsoka trailer

title: Intel is apparently winding down its NUC mini PCs after more than a decade
description: Intel has exited several side-businesses as it tries to stop losing money.

title: Google’s head of AR software quits, citing “unstable commitment and vision”
description: Departure follows layoffs, project cancellations, and other chaos.

title: Hackers exploit gaping Windows loophole to give their malware kernel access
description: Microsoft blocks a new batch of system drivers, but the loophole empowering them remains.

description: US and UK users can converse with Claude 2 through the Anthropic website.

description: "There’s only ONE Twitter," Linda Yaccarino tweeted.

title: The Nothing Phone 2 is official, with a US price of $599
description: It has a light-up back and last year's flagship SoC.

title: Here come the Moon landing missions (probably)
description: Three for NASA, and one each for India, Russia, and Japan.

title: The best Prime Day laptop deals aren’t on Amazon—here’s where to find them
description: These powerful laptops come with newer silicon and a more wallet-friendly price.

title: Amazon claims it isn’t a “Very Large Online Platform” to evade EU rules
description: Amazon, one of 19 platforms bound by new rules, says it is "unfairly singled out."

title: How AI can make gaming better for all players
description: Artificial intelligence can make gaming more accessible and learn what individuals need.

title: 87% of classic games are out of print. That’s a problem for gaming history.

title: Apple releases, quickly pulls Rapid Security Response update for 0-day WebKit bug
description: Update for iOS 16, macOS Ventura can be uninstalled if you're having problems.

title: Is distributed computing dying, or just fading into the backdrop?
description: There seems to be much less excitement about distributed computing these days.
